channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No lights on the bridge above the highway, 28th November
item.description:
When crossing by the bridge to reach the other side of the “highway” at night, it is pitch black, gloomy and looks dark and unsafe because there is no light on the bridge. When it’s night, I have to use my phone lamp torch to see the path. Also there are debris on this bridge and sometimes people hanging around. Please add some lights! this is not acceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped sofas, 28th November
item.description:
There are two separate sofas and chairs dumped, one on either side of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cumbrian Avenue, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ref: 8354962 unsolved issue. Trip hazards., 28th November
item.description:
Only part of the pavement has been fixed from my "solved issue", and the bit that has been fixed is absolutely shocking. No care taken in the look of it at all. Clearly this isn't being signed off by any supervisor as it looks like a blind person has screeded this concrete. As I said in my first complaint, the WHOLE pavement needs re doing in the whole of Dane Close. My mum recently tripped and pulled her muscle in her leg and she's nearly 70. Myself, or others will sue if any further injuries do occure as this has been complained about. As I have said before the road is full of elderly people, one in particular who is scared to use his mobility scooter because of the risk of falling out of it. This needs sorting. James Ball
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Dane Close, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, noisy manholes and uneven road, 28th November
item.description:
The road is in need of serious repair. There are potholes, broken/noisy manholes and uneven footing which is likely cause accidents. Heavy bin trucks travel up and down the road, and causes serious noise and disturbance to surrounding buildings.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Elsdale Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling, 28th November
item.description:
I am writing to report a serious and ongoing problem with dog fouling in our area. Every single day, there are multiple instances of dog mess left on the paths. My children have stepped in it several times, and it is extremely unpleasant and difficult to clean. Their shoes often need to be thrown away because they become too dirty to use. This situation occurs daily and is causing significant distress to our family. We kindly request that appropriate action be taken to address this issue. We have noticed that there are a few dog owners who repeatedly fail to clean up after their dogs. In particular, there is one dog owner whom we see most often leaving dog waste behind. We would appreciate it if this matter could be looked into, as it has become a persistent and unacceptable problem. Thank you for your attention and assistance. We look forward to a cleaner and safer environment for our children.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84-93, Tovil Close, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8451754, 28th November
item.description:
The issue number above IS NOT FIXED. Whoever was asked to collect the signs and bollard retrieved just one of the 3 items. Utter incompetence from start to finish. How on earth does council get run?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Parkhurst Road, Bexley, Greater London
